Our mission is to enable partners to build deep expertise and a thriving business practice with Pivotal.
Serverless
In September, our editorial focus was on Serverless. As interest in on-demand computing grows, learn how Pivotal is at the forefront of this exciting development practice.
Our crack team of curators has been hard at work gathering high quality content on our featured topic <[[https://content.pivotal.io/serverless-computing]]>. Below you’ll find a few pieces selected for our partner community.
Podcast:
- Dormain Drewitz and Jeff Kelly discuss patterns in serverless adoption <[[https://content.pivotal.io/pivotal-podcasts/bringing-observability-to-serverless-with-iopipe-ep-79]]> and observability best practices with IOPipe CEO Adam Johnson.
Video:
- Mark Fisher talks about Pivotal’s function framework <[[https://content.pivotal.io/springone-platform-2018/mark-fisher-pivotal-springone-platform-2018]]> Riff, and its operation on Google’s knative project.
- On the 2018 SpringOne main stage, Google’s Mark Chmarny talked about serverless and knative <[[https://content.pivotal.io/springone-platform-2018/day-1-keynote-mark-chmarny]]>.
Article:
- Is 'native' just a trendy word for anything related to the cloud? This article <[[https://www.solstice.com/fwd/knative-as-inversion-of-native-serverless-applications]]> looks at the value propositions of “nativeness” in Knative beyond the hype.
Don’t forget! You can embed the content stream of your choice in your own site! Find the embed code for Serverless and other content streams on the Partner Portal <[[https://partners.pivotal.io/English/Global/sales/partner-information.aspx#contentstream]]>.

October Interview
For this month's Q&A, we spoke with Melissa Larson, who leads our efforts with boutique system integrators.
1. Ten months on the job, what do you now see as the biggest opportunities for Pivotal’s ecosystem?
"Hands down, the biggest opportunity I see is our opinionated application transformation solutions. There are many companies that are selling IT solutions or customized tools. But few are taking on the work of guiding customers through the process of modernizing their legacy applications. I realize that it’s not as sexy as a new mobile application or blockchain experiment, but what is more important than reducing costs and getting software to market faster? By operating legacy applications more efficiently, you free up resources to compete as a software company in the digital world. The keys to application modernization success for partners are:
- Align to quantifiable business outcomes.
- Have a productized approach that makes it easy for customers to start
- Have an opinion on methods and tooling
- Use the abstractions to do the right thing
There is a lot of opportunity in digitizing existing processes, let alone transforming you your business operates through software. But you need to get your house in order first. Simplifying legacy applications must be done first to truly free the enterprise to innovate at start-up pace."
2. What is your number one piece of advice for new partners joining the Pivotal Ready Partner Program?
"At Pivotal, we partner differently. Our mission is to transform the way the world builds software. We do this with a maniacal focus on customer outcomes that is ingrained in every function of our business. Our measurement of success are the outcomes we deliver for customers. My best advice to a new partner is to set aside expectations based on other technology partnerships and focus on how we could accelerate the outcomes we deliver to our customers together. And be patient, selling transformation is hard work. :) "
3. What keeps you busy when you’re not engaged with partners?
"I am a partner and a parent. I spend my time exploring the world with my wife and our 2 year old daughter. Lately, we’ve also been preparing for twin girls expected in March! Other than that, I’m a proud midwestern nerd, with the stereotypical hobbies of ice-fishing, cross-country skiing, reading memoirs and historical fiction, social justice activism and growing vegetables. #GoT"
